claimRewards().details: See {_claimRewards}. Override that to implement custom logic.             See {_calculateRewards} for reward-calculation logic.

params._staker: Address for which to calculated rewards.

stake(uint256).details: See {_stake}. Override that to implement custom logic.

withdraw(uint256).details: See {_withdraw}. Override that to implement custom logic.

getRewardTokenBalance().notice: View total rewards available in the staking contract.

getStakeInfo(address).notice: View amount staked and rewards for a user.

setRewardRatio(uint256,uint256).notice: Set rewards per unit of time.           Interpreted as (numerator/denominator) rewards per second/per day/etc based on time-unit.           For e.g., ratio of 1/20 would mean 1 reward token for every 20 tokens staked.

setTimeUnit(uint80).notice: Set time unit. Set as a number of seconds.           Could be specified as -- x * 1 hours, x * 1 days, etc.

documentation.text: @dev The address of the native token wrapper contract.
@dev Address of ERC20 contract -- staked tokens belong to this contract.
@dev Decimals of staking token.
@dev Decimals of reward token.
@dev Next staking condition Id. Tracks number of conditon updates so far.
@dev Total amount of tokens staked in the contract.
@dev List of accounts that have staked that token-id.
@dev Mapping staker address to Staker struct. See {struct IStaking20.Staker}.
@dev Mapping from condition Id to staking condition. See {struct IStaking721.StakingCondition}
@dev Staking logic. Override to add custom logic.
@dev Withdraw logic. Override to add custom logic.
@dev Logic for claiming rewards. Override to add custom logic.
@dev View available rewards for a user.
@dev Update unclaimed rewards for a users. Called for every state change for a user.
@dev Set staking conditions.
@dev Calculate rewards for a staker.
@dev Exposes the ability to override the msg sender -- support ERC2771.
@notice View total rewards available in the staking contract.
